abstract: Firing the founder is often part of a strategy to flip the company to a new set of investors.
snippet: Firing the founder is often part of a strategy to flip the company to a new set of investors.
lead_paragraph: With all of Facebook’s struggles since its initial public offering, I suppose it’s not surprising that there were whispers over the summer that Mark Zuckerberg should be replaced as chief executive. But spare me. There is no one on Earth who is as qualified to run Facebook.

headline.main: Why Everyone Wants to Fire the Founder
